paragraphs.name: 7b35
paragraphs.text: Remember that your perception of your own body is shaped by a culture that hates fat wherever it appears. There is no telling a fatter friend that I hate the way I look, but it’s fine for you. There is no safe haven of hating your body that doesn’t also rely on logic that marginalizes mine. If you hate the fat on your body, that will color your perception of mine. Like any virus, you do not get to decide that you are resistant. You do not get to decide whether it is communicable. Do not transmit the virus back to your fat friend.

paragraphs.name: 333c
paragraphs.text: She may tell you about the parade of acquaintances who abandon backhanded compliments and polite slights, instead comfortably telling her she’s going to die. You’re going to get diabetes, and it’ll be your own damn fault. Are you really okay with that? What will that do to your family? She has become accustomed to passersby foretelling her death.

Doing all of that means building a different relationship between you and I. We can no longer relate over the desolation and loneliness we believe our bodies prophesy. We can no longer return to the comfortable small-talk of hating where our skin falls, whether it is convex and concave in the right places.

paragraphs.name: f762
paragraphs.text: Then you will start to hear about experiences that are fully unthinkable. A very fat friend may tell you about a flight attendant who refused to seat him on her flight, then refused a refund for an unused ticket. He will tell you how other passengers watched in silence, and let it happen. Another extended plus friend might tell you how she was denied a service job, because she couldn’t pass the weekly weigh-ins. You will ask if she’s thought of taking legal action. She will answer what’s the point? and she’ll be right. There is no legal precedent to protect her.

content.subtitle: “Well, we can’t all reach goal weight for the big day, can we?”
content.metaDescription: I’ll never forget the way I first heard of your mother. At the reception, he saw you speaking with your mother. “Well, we can’t all reach goal weight for the big day, can we?”

911dff50db79.title: Thank you for being you and for being a writer.

paragraphs.name: 2ee3
paragraphs.text: Thank you for being you and for being a writer. Your blog is a constant source of support for me at a time when I’ve never felt more painfully aware of my feeling about my own body. I often report your articles on my Facebook, and have been surprised by the comments I receive. It’s made me realise how many people are unwilling to accept the existence of any experience other than their own.

753e3246bf0d.title: Oh the irony that this post is asking for someone’s concerns to be heard and the comments demanding…

paragraphs.name: dce5
paragraphs.text: Oh the irony that this post is asking for someone’s concerns to be heard and the comments demanding that this person accept they are wrong begin. This post ends with “I need you to hear me.” If you read the story and your response is to shame them, you have proven the author’s point by your response.

fddd6d00d1b9.title: Well, it really is in your best interest to figure out how to get in better shape.

paragraphs.name: 21a9
paragraphs.text: Well, it really is in your best interest to figure out how to get in better shape. Lots of research on exercise and nutrition shows that it isn’t as hard as you think. However the first thing that needs to be changed is the mind.

90a773a801b8.title: Being fat makes them sick which makes them move less which makes them more ill.

paragraphs.text: Being fat makes them sick which makes them move less which makes them more ill. A cursed circle. How good is life if you can’t move? Then you are confined to a bed waiting for death way before your time? How about watching that happen to someone you love? If someone got into car accident you would take them to hospital, not say “you are beautiful…

paragraphs.name: ab1c
paragraphs.text: So I have a question that I want to ask as a thin person engaged to a larger man. How does one bring up the issue of health and weight (a legitimate concern) without seeming like a total jerk? I want him to take the concerns of his doctors seriously, if solely for the fact that he is already 10 years older than I am and I want to keep him around longer? If not for me, in case we have kiddos…

I have lost 60 pounds in 18 months, and have about 60 more to go before I’m at my ideal. The mental health aspects of this kind of weight loss are key — your identity changes as you become…

98610b730d2b.title: Your personality and mind matter more than your appearance.

paragraphs.name: 1f6e
paragraphs.text: Your personality and mind matter more than your appearance. What also matters is your health. Some of us care about your health whether you perceive that as hostility or not, it is genuine concern. Health does not define itself by appearance. However, we cannot allow people to re-define health by appearance either. These are very important nuances.

d43084ea607b.title: Exercise is not the answer to losing weight; you would have to run a dozen miles to lose the…

paragraphs.name: faf0
paragraphs.text: Exercise is not the answer to losing weight; you would have to run a dozen miles to lose the calories from just one chocolate sundae! Proper eating is the key. No one needs processed sugars and starches so prevalent in the American diet. Just not eating those two nutritionally-useless items will cause weight loss.

f0abb1428923.title: It seems that somehow, we have forgotten to apply The Golden Rule to ourselves and to others.

paragraphs.name: ff54
paragraphs.text: It seems that somehow, we have forgotten to apply The Golden Rule to ourselves and to others. What fat shamers seem to forget is that commenting on some other human body is a supreme violation of personal space and not a simple entitled, verbalized insult. Once upon a time, parents taught their kids not say anything if they couldn’t think of anything…

ede38ebdd3d2.title: This is a good piece of writing and a reminder to be kind (to ourselves and others).

paragraphs.name: f33a
paragraphs.text: This is a good piece of writing and a reminder to be kind (to ourselves and others). But there are deeper aspects too, imo. We so often co-relate concepts of fat and thin with competency and success, which is illogical if we but spent 2 seconds thinking about it.

cfcd6a0a690b.title: “a different relationship between you and I”

paragraphs.name: 6e2c
paragraphs.text: “a different relationship between you and I”

paragraphs.name: 1c9b
paragraphs.text: …between you and me

Because it’s entirely reasonable. Why should an airline absorb the cost of your poor planning and then defray it to other customers? This person should buy two tickets ahead of time. They watched in silence because nobody wants to sit next to someone that fat on an airplane.
